snippet: The United Nations Security Council on Friday called for South Sudan’s feuding political leaders to resolve a mounting crisis and threatened targeted sanctions against perpetrators of ethnic violence.
abstract: United Nations Security Council calls for South Sudan’s feuding political leaders Pres Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar to put into effect cease-fire and form transitional government, threatening targeted sanctions against perpetrators of ethnic violence.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations Security Council on Friday called for South Sudan’s feuding political leaders to resolve a mounting crisis and threatened targeted sanctions against perpetrators of ethnic violence.
